betterquesting:10.desc:8: In all survival situations and primitive living a knife or Working Blade can be the difference in life and death. Here on our island this is no different. Logs can be stripped of their Bark by Shift Right Clicking on the Logs with our Work Blade. We might get Sticks from Breaking Leaves.

On our lonely island, there are some odd brown blocks that appear to be some sort of Living Root. Be careful when breaking these blocks as they hold the beginnings of life.  Oddly enough, they can be crafted to give us our tree of life. Use the living root to craft our first Spruce Sapling. The Logs of this tree can not be broken by your fist along.  You will need to obtain a Flint Hatchet to break these Logs.§a§c§e§c  --Use only what you need. This special item will be needed later to bring more life to our island--
Maybe harvesting the Leaves off of our "Tree of Life" will be useful in the future.
As with harvesting trees, it appears that we need a tool to process our Logs into usable Planks.

Obtain Flint and knap it against the only Bedrock you can find to get Flaked Flint and Flaked Flint Points. Flint and other items can be knapped against hard blocks to produce different items. The only piece of Bedrock appears to be under the ice. Our flint sometimes flakes off into the void. What if we wade in the Water when flaking flint will that help us collect it easier?

The trees here on our island are tougher than they are in other worlds. Looks like we are going to need a tool to assist with harvesting. To get the Plant Twine we need to Shift Right Click on Logs to obtain Bark.  Use the Bark and your Work Blade to to get the Plant Fiber.  Sticks can be obtained from breaking Leaves on our trees.
The ability to start fire is a necessity. A Fire Bow should be a good start. The Fire Bow can be used as a weapon if we have Sticks in our invenotry.

Add a Stone Gallagher to this and we have a simple machine can easily crush materials for us. To operate the Block Breaker right click on the machine with an empty hand to draw back the Gallagher.  Place the block you want broken in front of the Block Breaker. To break the block Shift Right Click on the Block Breaker to bring the Gallagher down on block.

We cannot continue to work off of our personal 2x2 crafting grid. How about we upgrade, so we can build more complex tools. This starter Crafting Table is nice but is limited to what it can do. When we get the chance to upgrade to a regular Crafting Table we should do it.

Log Stacks are an early way to get both Ash and Charcoal.  To get Split Logs, right click Stripped Logs with a Hatchet. These Split Logs can be crafted into Log Stacks. Use a Fire Bow on the Log Stacks to ignite the stack. Once we get a torch, we use it to ignite things.

Ash is an important material that we will need later. To get it, we may have to sacrifice some materials. Set your Log Stack on a fireproof block and light it with the Fire Bow.  Over time it will burn down to Ash.

With Dirt comes more life on our island. Dirt is chemically made up of 45 percent rock particles, 25 percent water, 25 percent air, and 5 percent organic matter. Looks like our soil is a little less than perfect, but should meet our needs.

Cobblestone can be broken down to get Gravel and then Sand. So, it would seem that it's pretty important on our island. We can construct basic Cobblestone, but it's going to take some materials.  Mortar can be made by crafting Mud Clumps and Ash.  Mud Clumps can be made by crafting Dirt Piles around a Water Bowl.
It appears that we can get Pebbles by Shift Right Clicking on Grass or Dirt blocks. What an odd place this is.
Now who doesn't like a Fortune 5 Pickaxe? Once you get your Crucible loaded, you'll have to pour this wonderful tool into a cast.
On our little island we can obtain the basic resources from mobs that spawn around us. We should strategically place out Mob Farm away from the Mana Flame.
To continue supporting the construction effort of our little island, we are going to need a way to repair and build new tools. Remember, Flint is life.
We have produced Dirt, Cobblestone, and Gravel. It would appear that the last of the 4 major elements is Sand. Crush Gravel blocks with the Block Breaker to get Sand.

With a little work we can start to get primitive building materials. Adobe can be dried into Bricks that, hopefully, will build a nice material processing structure. Place down the Brick Form and add the Adobe Brick Mix to the form. Over time this material will turn from a wet looking mud to a dried Adobe Brick.  When complete you can collect the bricks by breaking the mold or right clicking the bricks out.

--Drying times for thatch can take an very long time. There are two options to get dry thatch. One requires time, while the other returns less.

Can it be that cheap? Forging tools may take time, but on our resource restricted island, what is a bit of time to get the right tool for the job? Let’s start by getting the right equipment for forging operations. To use the Bloomery we need need to connect it with a Piston Bellows (look for the notch at the bottom to connect it to).  Add Charcoal to the Bloomery and light with a Torch or Fire Bow.  We will first need to cook our Soft Crucible.  Place the Soft Crucible into the lit Bloomery and then pump the Piston Bellows to increase the heat in the Bloomery. You can see the temperature of the Bloomery by right clicking the Bloomery with an empty hand. Once the proper temperature is reached the Crucible will be begin to cook.  Pay attention to both the Time and Temperature of the cooking.  When the crucible is complete, you will need to remove it from the Bloomery with a pair of Stone Tongs (see next quest) and place it on a fireproof surface for it to cool.

This Cauldron has the ability to perform some pretty cool miracles. We will need to heat the Cauldron with something.  How about some Netherrack or Lava? Unless we can find a better way to heat our Cauldron, we may need to go to the nether earlier than expected.  I think there is a Botania way to get to the nether with a Daisy and Blaze Mesh.  When using the Cauldron we can shift right click on the side with a Ladle to see the current status.  To remove items from the Cauldron we can right click on the top of the Cauldron. From the nether we can find a Sticks from a flaming plant that can be crafted into a Ladle. We will need Lacquer Sticks to create better tools. Lacquer is made in the Cauldron combining Water and Urushi. When the Urushi has changed over Lacquer we can then add Sticks to the Cauldron for the final portion of creating Lacquer Sticks. (Hint: We may need to work on the next quest line before we can finish our Cauldron.)
Our little cauldron can help us create Obsidian that we can harvest without a Pickaxe. Looks like a trip to find Lava is required to get obsidian.
How amazing is it that we can create armor out of this super hard material? Maybe we will soon be able to put it to the test.

Our little island is blessing, but we need to travel a bit to get more resources. Once we are protected and geared up, we can embark on a new adventure. We should probably bring back some resources to upgrade our tools.

We have the large equipment for forging, but what about the smaller items that help out. We also need to create a Stone Anvil. To do this we will need to place a piece of Smooth Stone near our Forge setup.  After we have cooked our first piece of Iron in the Bloomery and let the Crucible cool, we can then break the Crucible and obtain our Wrought Iron Ingot.  This first piece of Iron will need to be used to create the Stone Anvil.  Add Charcoal the Forge and light it with either a Torch or Fire Bow. To increase the heat of the Forge pump the Piston Bellows.  We can check the heat of the forge by right clicking with an empty hand.  Wrought Iron will need the Forge to be at 800 degrees.  Place the Wrought Iron Ingot on to the Forge and wait until it turns glowing orange.  We can then use our Stone Tongs to remove it from the Forge.  Place our hot Wrought Iron Ingot onto the top of our Smooth Stone that we placed near our Forge.  We will then need our Stone Gallagher that is in our Block Breaker to pound down the iron onto the stone creating our Stone Anvil.
On the way to making Steel tools, we need to clean our Iron Dust and prepare it for the conversion to Steel. It is rumored that the Nether holds the Lime Slack that we need to produce Clean Iron.

Steel is one of the hardest materials that we can currently obtain on our island. It will mine just about anything we see fit to throw at it. To create Steel we add a Clean Iron Ingot and High Grade Charcoal to a Crucible. The procedure is the same as Wrought Iron, heat in Bloomery, cool and break Curcible, and obtain Steel Ingot. One catch, we need High Grade Charcoal and that is obtained from Ironwood or Jungle Log Stacks.
Steel tools are everyday tools that can get the job done. Bronze tools might have a better return, but cannot compete with the durability of Steel tools.

Who would have believed that we would have the opportunity to pour materials that could improve our life. After creating the Casting Form we will need to place Casting Mud in a negative imprint of the item we want to craft.  We should think about how these items would be built on the Stone Anvil.
The Petal Apothecary is the epicenter of where we create all of our Flowers. It's easy enough to get a little Cobblestone to create this wonderful tool.
This beautiful white Flower will help us start our new journey, down a new path.
This book will take us to new places and help us become more dependent on our island.  To obtain the Lexica Botania feed a Sapling to the Mana Spark that is located just off of the island.
These tools will help us produce mana that is sort of the life essence of creating new and exciting things.

This evil Pumpkin, combined with Iron Bars, can produce some pretty crazy results. Make sure to have an area that is fire-proof.  Place a Fel Pumpkin on two vertically stacked Iron Bars to spawn a Blaze.
As with all of these Flowers, this Altar has some amazing abilities that can help us create wonderful things.

Could this block along with our beautiful Pure White Daisy, allow us to get to the nether? Interesting thoughts.  Let us try configuring the Blaze Mesh in a nether portal layout and place the Pure White Daisy next to it.
This wonderful Rod creates land mass for us. We are now on a new path. What does the future hold us? Farms? Animals? Who knows!
The block placed underneath a Mana Pool will convert all sorts of weird things. It's amazing that that will help us create even more items.
Is this a simpler way to get Cobblestone? Maybe not easier than a Cobblestone generator, but how about using this Rod to help us build and place blocks?
This crazy flower will turn Stone into Ores. That's just crazy!
Who knows when you're going to need some clay. Well, I guess this Flower will help us with that.
This Flower will accelerate the growth around our farms. We can only hope that we have enough food to never starve again.
We will never again be alone once we get some friendly animals to join us on our island.
To get our new Ore processing off the ground, we need to collect Clay and Sand to create a new Brick, that will be the backbone of our Foundry.
Using our Bloomery and Forge, we can easily create simple metals, but we need some sort of apparatus to create more complex alloys.
With our new Foundry, we need a way to cast our molten metals and alloys into something useful.
It’s been easy enough to smash our Ores with a Hammer, but is it the most efficient it gets? Maybe this Plate Mold will be more efficient.
It's nice having a way to actually get a decent return for our hard work of collecting ores. This Ingot Cast will come in handy in the future.
Do we really need a Block Mold? Well it might not hurt and maybe we can just let it run while we work on other things.

The base that our Foundry is built off is heat. When combined with a Melting Crucible, our Burner Heater creates the heat required to smelt down our Ores into molten metals. Place the Burner under the Crucible to heat it and fuel the Burner with Coal or Charcoal.
We need fluid storage for your molten metals. This basic 16 bucket storage container will help for the short term.
This standard fluid storage container can hold 24 buckets of fluid.
The basic Melting Crucible can reach temperatures of 2000K and can transform most of our Ores and Dust into a molten state.
The standard Melting Crucible can reach temperatures of 2500K and can transform most of our Ores and Dust into a molten state.
The Induction Heater can create heat with the assistance of power. This Heater is a step up from our previous Heater.
Black Quartz is obtained from Black Quartz Ore. It is the building block of the majority of machines that will help us automate our life.
The Atomic Reconstructor can assist us in getting better automation and resource gathering. We will definitely need to find some way to power this crazy thing.
A Coal Generator is a basic generator that provides us a way to turn Coal into Crystal Flux power.
Canola is a plant that grows quickly and can be turned into multiple fuel types.
This Oil Generator will produce a fair amount of power to help with our automation.
Refined Canola Oil will get us a better return in our Oil Generator. Looks like we just need to send it through a Fermenting Barrel.
Crystallized Oil will get us an even better return of 280 CF/t in our Oil Generator. Crystallized Oil is created by throwing a Crystallized Canola Seed into Refined Canola Oil.

Empowered Oil will get us the best return in our Oil Generator (400 CF/t). Empowered Oil is created by throwing an Empowered Canola Seed into Crystallized Oil. This Oil can also be transformed into Crude Oil that can then be used for other purposes.
Maybe we can use these two items to automate our Ore collection processes.
It's always nice to have an automated way of producing ore Dusts or even other products. This simple Crusher should help out a bit.
With this Powered Furnace, we will be able to process materials twice as fast and with power, negating the need for Coal or Charcoal, allowing us to free it up for other uses.
This item will help us transfer energy from the generators to the apparatuses that need energy.
This lens, when attached to our Atomic Reconstructor, can produce metal and gem Ores when Stone is placed in front of it. Now this should really speed up our resource collection process.
This item will help us transfer fluids.
This tricky little Laser will move items from one place to another.

We have scoured the ends of the galaxy to find a metal that can assist us in traveling off our island and possibly back home. Before selecting and accepting this quest, we should probably make sure we have some survivalist equipment on us. Grab a Backpack and load up some things we may need to survive.

pages:9.0:8: {"text":"Congratulations! You have survived and thrived through Primal Skies.  Instead of being teleported to our home overworld we oddly find ourselves on an island in a water world.  The waters surrounding our island looks to be teaming with dangerous creatures."}
pages:9.1:8: {"text":"We should be able to survive here for a while with the stuff we brought from our island.  Please build, create, and craft till your heart\u0027s desire.\n\nThank you for playing Primal Skies.  It seems odd  to leave the pack with one stuck on an island with no"}
pages:9.2:8: {"text":"future plan.  Well that is because we have already started working on the second part of Primal Skies.  In order to keep the packs playable across as many computer systems as possible, we have decided to keep the pack smaller than most so it loads and"}
pages:9.3:8: {"text":"plays for as many people as possible.  Stay tuned for the second phase and good luck in your future endeavor to get off of your water island."}

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Uninspected Ore is a key to our chemistry set. Utilize the provided manual to create materials out of almost nothing. Even though the quest book helps us to navigate our chemistry kit, we will be required to research and reference the manual.
Osmium will assist us in a developing better automation and will give us a better return on our hard-earned resources.
We only have a single block of Water, so we are going to need a way to get more. We should make something that can collect Water while it rains.
For crafting certain items, we are going to need Water. The only thing that even remotely resembles a Bucket is a Bowl, so let's fill one up.

To create Charcoal, we are going to need to take a Log Stack and surround it with Dirt on all sides.  We will need to light the Log Stack with our Fire Bow before we place the last block of Dirt.  When we get more Dirt, we can add more Log Stacks.  Just make sure that all sides are covered with Dirt.

We can forge an Iron Pickaxe that will help us as we adventure out.  To craft our Pickaxe, we will first need to forge and hammer the Pickaxe Head.  This can be achieved by heating a Wrought Iron Ingot in the Forge and then moving it to the Stone Anvil and shift right clicking the ingot into the center of the Stone Anvil.  we can hammer the larger iron chunk into smaller chunks using the Stone Gallagher.  This will get us nine chunks/nuggets of Iron.  We can use our Stone Tongs to move chunks around on the Stone Anvil.  The pattern for the Pickaxe Head will be three nuggets centered on the second row from the top and two nuggets on the row below that at ends of the previous row.  This will form what looks like an arc or Pickaxe Head.  This will then need to be hammered with the Stone Gallagher to create the actual Pickaxe Head and remove it from the Stone Anvil.  We will also need to create Lacquered Stick from the Urushi and Water in the Cauldron.
Using Storage Drawers we can start to organize our items.
A great way to start with some basic automated storage is Simple Storage Networks.
For a more powerful storage solution we can use Refined Storage as an option.
XNet is one option we have to move items between machines. It looks a little confusing at first but we can figure this out.

The Profiling Bench is an unpowered machine that allows to reshape materials and is used to cast most of the machines parts. It has a selector in front of the press showing the possible shapes and it can be scrolled by punching the block (punching while sneaking reverts the direction. Using a valid item on the machine, it gets placed under the press which then starts moving while clicking again removes the content. The machine can be automated with hoppers or any transport system to make it work continuously. A server helps to sequentially cast different parts made of the same input material.

The Mineral Sizer allows to crush materials based on how fine the grain of the product must be.  The smaller the grain is supposed to be, the heavier the process can be, requiring more power, time, and wearing. The machine is powered by fuel power and requires 8 Crushing Gears as consumables. The power station must use fuel only. The controller accepts the martial to crush and sets the comminution level for the desired output by acting on the slider. If the block is powered by a Redstone signal, its level overrides the slider value. Each tank requires 4 gears consumed accordingly with the level of the comminution, so the first gear in line may break faster than the last. The collector receives the crushed product and must be connected to a transport system to keep it always free.

The Lab Blender is a multiblock device that allows us to mix different ingredients into a mixture. While the controller handles the operations, ingredients can be freely injected form the upper tank in any slot, as long as only the valid ones for the desired recipe are inserted. Alternatively, a memory system allows us to lock the tank slots to accept only specified ingredients. The controller also shows a preview of the recipe currently recognized. The device is composed of 2 elements.

The Evaporation Tank is a small tank fillable with water that slowly evaporates revealing a layer of Raw Salt. This layer can be manually harvested using a shovel on top of the tank or sent via a transport system to a Seasoning Rack to become Refined Salt.
The Seasoning Rack is an unpowered device operating as an object processor where ingredients can be turned into others after an interval.
The Slurry Pond is an unpowered device that allows us to produce fluid substances by the macerating a solid ingredient into a fluid solvent.

The Chemical Extractor is the final stage of the processing chain in which chemical elements are isolated by decomposing specimen shards.  The number of recovered elements rough depends on specimen formulas and the intensity of the process.

The Reforming Reactor allows us to produce advanced gases and fluid compounds via the reaction of two gases and various catalysts. The system has two outputs handling fluid or gaseous products. The Reactor takes two series of Catalysts, System and Reaction Catalysts.

The Lab Oven is a device that allows us to produce acids and solutions by the reaction of different ingredients. The Reactor accepts two types of solid ingredients: a solute and/or a catalyst, depending on the recipe.  During the process, the solute is consumed and the catalyst is damaged and will last several cycles. The Fluid Input/Output Systems handle the solvents required for the recipes and resulting products.

The Gasification Plant is a multiblock structure that allows us to produce gases from the reaction of solutions at high temperatures.  Each gas has it own temperature threshold, at which the production starts, and it must be kept constant by supplying fuel to the plant.

The Leaching Vat allows us to extract specimens from their Gangue by washing them through acids.  It performs three phases of acid washing with Sodium Hydroxide, Hydrochloric Acid, and good old fashion H2O. The Leaching Vat also produces a by product of Leachate that can be further processed.
We can get Sodium Hydroxide from mixing Water and Chloride Bearing Compound in the Lab Oven.
We can get Sulfuric Acid from mixing Water and Sulfur Bearing Compound in the Lab Oven.

The Cryogenic Distillation Plant allows us to extract specific elements through an air separation process. In its entirety, the structure works by acquiring and processing cooled air and collects the isolated elements in the final vessels. This structure is a large multiblock structure that has over 20 blocks.

The Gas Purifier is a multi-block structure that allows us to perform a purifying process on a gas. The result is a mutated version of the initial gas.

 It may be worth having more than one Gas Purifier.  We should think of using one to produce Syngas from Raw Syngas that is made in the Gasification Plant. Syngas can then be pumped into our Power Stations to remove the need for Coal.

The Gasification Plant is a multiblock structure that allows us to produce gases from the reaction of solutions at high temperatures.  Each gas has it own temperature threshold, at which the production starts, and it must be kept constant by supplying fuel to the plant.

 A second Gasification Plant can produce Raw Syngas that is the start to a fuel that can run our Power Stations.
Cineris Carpet can move mobs in our mob farm.  We will need to go to the nether to get some Cineris.
Cineris Carpet can move mobs in our mob farm.  We will need to go to the nether to get some Cineris.
This quest is to update the Quest Book when the mod updates.

The first machine that we need, as we start progressing to the stars, is the Circuit Fabricator.  The Circuit Fabricator creates Basic Wafers and Advanced Wafers.  These Wafers are an integral building block for our future machines.
Our next machine needs to be a Compressor.  This little machine will compact ingots into more durable, compressed versions of the material. The Compressor runs on coal, or other combustibles.

On our Island there are two ways to obtain Fuel for our Rockets. The first is turning Empowered Oil into Crude Oil with the Pure Daisy. It would then need to be refined in the Refinery to make Fuel. Another way, that we can obtain fuel is to process it through our large chemistry set. Combining Syngas and Oxygen Gas in a Reforming Reactor will give us Fuel. Both ways are complicated, but we are talking about producing fuel.
Eventually, we will be able to create Oxygen while in space. Before that, we need to focus on collecting Oxygen on our island. We will need a couple of machines to make the right type of Oxygen.
To breathe in space, we need a triad of equipment to supply Oxygen to us.

To construct our first Rocket, we need to craft a NASA Workbench.  Once we have this crazy looking machine, we can build our Tier 1 Rocket. This Rocket will take us to a Space Station or the Moon. Is this as good as an Apollo Rocket?

The Rocket Launch Pad is needed to launch our Spaceship out of the atmosphere.

 Rocket Launch Pad tiles are a multi-block and must be placed in a 3 x 3 square to create a functional launch pad. This means that they will not function until several of them are placed in the right shape. Upon placing the final piece, the Launchpad will build itself. Once completed, our Rocket of choice can be loaded by placing it onto any block of the launch pad, which will cause it to appear on the central block. Our ship is now ready to launch but we need to do a couple of additional things to ensure our safety.
The Fuel Loader is a machine that is necessary to supply fuel to our Rocket or to a future Moon Buggy.

Before we head off on our first trip to the moon we need to get a couple additional things first. First up, make sure to load the rocket with plenty of fuel so that we have enough for the return journey. There is no way to make fuel on the Moon. A checklist of things we are going to need:
-Parachute
-Fuel Loader - Essential
-Power Source to power Fuel Loader
-Empty Canister 
-Additional Fuel Source
-Oxygen Mask, Oxygen Gear, and Oxygen Tank
Food
-Armor and a suitable weapon
-Building materials for our Moon base if we plan to build one

The Moon is not actually made of Cheese and there are some benefits to this barren wasteland of moon rock. We need keep an eye out of a mysterious Moon Dungeon that hold the Template to a bigger, nastier Rocket.
We continue our quest to return home by traveling through the Solar System.  Our newly minted Tier 2 Rocket should allow us to reach the red planet of Mars.

One of the ores that we need to craft our portal home is found here on Mars.  Nine Desh Ores should suffice to create the two blocks of Desh we need for our portal, but we may want to get more as it may be required for further progression.
The nice Martians need our help in ridding their planet of a Three Headed Monster. Our reward, a new Schematic that can allows us to continue our adventure through the Solar System.
Before we can go to Mars we need a bit of Thermal Protection.
We need to craft an extreme suit of Thermal Padding before we blast-off for Venus.
The Tier 3 Schematic, we were awarded on Mars, will help us to build a larger Rocket that can take us even further into the stars.
This Ore is the keystone to our portal off of our island.
No Description

This is the stock minecraft tier of directly smelting ores into ingots.

1 Raw Ore → Energized Smelter → 1 Ingot

This tier doubles ingot yield using the Enrichment Chamber.

1 Raw Ore → Enrichment Chamber → 2 Dusts → Energized Smelter → 2 Ingots

This tier triples ingot yield. It uses the Purification Chamber, Crusher and Enrichment Chamber. The Purification Chamber requires a source of Oxygen.

1 Raw Ore + Oxygen → Purification Chamber → 3 Clumps

3 Clumps → Crusher → 3 Dirty Dusts → Enrichment Chamber → 3 Dusts → Energized Smelter → 3 Ingots

Oxygen Can be obtained like so:

Water → Electric Pump → Electrolytic Separator → Oxygen

Hint: You can use Gas-Burning Generator to recycle Hydrogen produced by Electrolytic Separator back to energy. That saves a lot of energy.

This tier quadruples ingot yield. It uses the Solar Evaporation Plant, Chemical Injection Chamber, Electrolytic Separator, Chemical Infuser, Purification Chamber, Electrolytic Separator, Crusher and Enrichment Chamber.

1 Raw Ore + Hydrogen Chloride →Chemical Injection Chamber → 4 Shards

4 Shards + Oxygen → Purification Chamber → 4 Clumps

4 Clumps → Crusher → 4 Dirty Dusts → Enrichment Chamber → 4 Dusts → Energized Smelter → 4 Ingots

The chain to make Hydrogen Chloride is self-sustaining but quite involved.
 
Water → Electric Pump → Solar Evaporation Plant → Brine → Electrolytic Separator → Sodium and Chlorine

Or

Salt → Chemical Oxidizer → Gaseous Brine → Rotary Condensentrator → Brine → Electrolytic Separator → Sodium and Chlorine

Hydrogen (from water electrolysis) and Chlorine → Chemical Infuser → Hydrogen Chloride

This tier quintuples ingot yield. It uses the Rotary Condensentrator, Chemical Dissolution Chamber, Chemical Washer, Chemical Crystallizer, Chemical Oxidizer, Solar Evaporation Plant, Chemical Injection Chamber, Electrolytic Separator, Chemical Infuser, Purification Chamber, Electrolytic Separator, Crusher and Enrichment Chamber.

1 Raw Ore + Sulfuric Acid → Chemical Dissolution Chamber → Ore Slurry

Ore Slurry + Water → Chemical Washer → Clean Ore Slurry → Chemical Crystallizer → Crystals

Crystals are then put into a Tier 3 setup to be processed.

You need a chain to make Hydrogen Chloride the same as Tier 3. You also need a source of Gravel/Flint/Gunpowder.

Gunpowder + Hydrogen Chloride → Chemical Injection Chamber → Sulfur

Sulfur → Chemical Oxidizer → Sulfur Dioxide

Sulfur Dioxide + Oxygen → Chemical Infuser → Sulfur Trioxide

Water → Rotary Condensentrator → Water Vapor

Water Vapor + Sulfur Trioxide → Chemical Infuser → Sulfuric Acid
The Combiner allows us to create an Ore Block from four Dust. Imagine having a system that gives an excess in ore dust. That would save a lot of hassle.

The Air Compressor allows us to produce compressed air used in some processes inside the mod.  The compressing units push air inside the attached container as a buffer for further transportation through the Gas Pipeline.

The Heat Exchanger is a device that processes gases by cooling them down through a liquid refrigerant system. For a recipe to be recognized, the output gas must have a lower temperature than the input gas. It accepts any fluid as coolant as long as its temperature is already lower than input gas.

The Gas Purifier is a multi-block structure that allows us to perform a purifying process on a gas. The result is a mutated version of the initial gas.

 It may be worth having more than one Gas Purifier.  We should think of using one to produce Syngas from Raw Syngas that is made in the Gasification Plant. Syngas can then be pumped into our Power Stations to remove the need for Coal.

The Air Compressor allows us to produce Compressed Air used in processes.  The compressing unit pushes air inside the attached container as a buffer for further transportation through the Gas Pipeline.
Hemp Seeds are obtained from breaking Tall Grass.  Hemp will get us started producing fabrics and other useful items here on the island.

The Millstone can receive Mechanical Power from a Hand Crank, or by an Axle from the top or bottom. When powered, the gear inside turns and crushes materials into a finer form. The Items are ground up one at a time, then ejected horizontally into the world.

 Millstones with have a Blocked notification, this is because to properly rotate it needs space all around it so no full blocks can be next to it!

The Hand Crank is the earliest form of creating Mechanical Power, it can power any machine that does not need continuous Mechanical Power. For example, the Millstone will be the first machine you’ll want to use the Hand Crank on to begin creating your windmill.

The Windmills are the most basic way of Mechanical Power aside from the Hand Crank.

 To place this windmill it needs a 13x13x1 cleared space with an axle at the center, click on the axle with the Windmill item. There cannot be any blocks above this windmill to operate.

The Cauldron is a bulk cooking device that can cook massive amounts of food and other crafting recipes. With this, you can toss massive amounts of foodstuffs into it at the start of a new day, go out and do digging work, and come back to most of your foodstuffs cooked.

 It’s important to note that additional fires in a 3x3 underneth the cauldron will make it cook food and other recipes much faster than if you were to just use one flame. The stoked flame of the Hibachi will apply it’s effects better if the entire 3x3 under it is filled with hot fire.

The Saw is a mechanical block that is used for cutting blocks into smaller pieces. It takes mechanical power from any side other than the blade. When powered and a block with a recipe is in front of it the block will drop into the items from the recipe.

The Filtered Hopper will pick up items above it based on its filter. It can be filtered by putting an item in the top slot. If no item is in the filter slot then any item can pass. If any non-filtering item is placed in the slot only that item can pass.

 When the Hopper receives mechanical power, it will output it’s content to the inventory below it be that be a block or an entity; if there is no block below it will simply drop the items on the ground.
The Kiln is a multiblock structure that is used as an in-world crafting device for many advanced materials.
The Hibachi will create a continuous fire source when given a Redstone Signal. Only the flames of a Hibachi are strong enough to be stoked by a Bellows.

The Bellows is an air blade, that when given mechanical power will contract and blow a gust of air in the direction it is facing. It will not retracted until the mechanical power is disabled, this can be done by sending a redstone signal to a Gearbox somewhere down the line. The gust of air created by the Bellows is able to stoke fire, though normal fire sources are not strong enough to not be blown out.

To grow a rare type of flower that will help us flourish, we will need to create a particular kind of fertilizer.  We can build this Floral Fertilizer from either our unique roots or by crafting it with items.
Let's get life started on our small island. Using PrimalCore we realize we can actually survive and flourish. Gravel and Flint are early game life blood.
What a crazy book we have just received. It appears that we have the recipes to help us better our island and create some amazing things.
Tired of only getting Nuggets from Ores or fighting off Pigmen for nether treasure? Try creating a Foundry to process well-earned Ores.

Through the use of Actually Additions we can further expand our island and start automating Ore production and other processes. We can also find a new way to produce Ores that may be a little more efficient and environmentally friendly.
Maybe it's time to see if we can go back home.

Rockhounding Mod: Chemistry is a mod that allows us to create new materials out of Uninspected Ore. We are provided a guide to this overgrown chemistry set. Move from Uninspected Ore to an Osmium Ingot.
Primal Skies has a few storage options.  They range from simple to complex and can grow as our Island does.
Updates the Quest Book when the modpack updates.
Our Island and the Nether have supported us well to this point. Let’s look to the stars and see what else we can find.
We have used an Orechid and Lens of the Miner to collect ores. Up until now, we had limited ore processing capabilities. Using Mekanism, we can get a better return for our hard-earned ores.
Better with Mods brings some really nice features that can help us during our early days on our island.
